messages.content: Using the latest SnarkyJS branch, it works fine. What version are you using?
i used npm to install snarkyjs
That's weird - I just created a fresh project and just copy-pasted over the example. Can you double check? Are you running the exact example or did you make any changes?
Thanks for the hint, i found it out.

I just read through the Merkle Tree example. Why is the smart contract balance initialized with addInPlace() in deploy method? 

this.balance.addInPlace(UInt64.from(initialBalance));

What does that do? Is it really necessary thinking that the feePayer already paid for the deployment transaction?

https://github.com/o1-labs/snarkyjs/blob/db744c8fff7f2969d1e658ad5e5a10908cc46ebc/src/examples/zkapps/merkle_tree/merkle_zkapp.ts#L78

embeds.title: snarkyjs/merkle_zkapp.ts at db744c8fff7f2969d1e658ad5e5a10908cc46eb...
embeds.description: Typescript/Javascript framework for zk-SNARKs and zkApps - snarkyjs/merkle_zkapp.ts at db744c8fff7f2969d1e658ad5e5a10908cc46ebc · o1-labs/snarkyjs

messages.content: that's just a way of initially giving the new zkApp account some balance, thats seperate from the account creation fee
Must the zkApp account have a balance for the Merkle Tree logic to work?

Thanks. Similar to my understanding.
That means, addInPlace() is not needed to be called.
